meanings.definition: A long piece of cloth worn around the waist or over the shoulder, especially by men in India.
meanings.sent1: The man proudly displayed his colorful dhootie during the festival.
meanings.sent2: In India, it is common to see men wearing a dhootie as part of their traditional attire.
meanings.sent3: When the wind blew, the dhootie flew like a flag behind the man.
meanings.sent4: His dhootie was a vibrant rainbow, adding a splash of color to the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the dhootie felt comforting against his skin.

meanings.definition: To wrap or drape oneself in a dhootie.
meanings.sent1: She decided to dhootie herself in a beautiful silk cloth for the special occasion.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the groom will dhootie himself in a traditional garment.
meanings.sent3: He tried to dhootie himself in a bedsheet, but it ended up looking like a messy toga.
meanings.sent4: The dancer gracefully dhootied herself in flowing fabric, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: As the magician waved his hands, he seemed to dhootie himself in a cloak of mystery.
